name: Nephi Dies, Gives Plates to Jacob
Ammon Searches for Land of Nephi
note:
After three years of peace.
King Benjamin dies.

name: Mosiah is Born
note: This is 30 years before he is made king.

name: Amaleki Writes
note: Gives the records to King Benjamin at some point after Mosiah is born and before Mosiah is crowned.

name: Zeniff Returns to Land of Nephi
Linhi Arrives in Zarahemlah
note: The journey was 12 days for Helam. If Helam is 8 days from Lehi-Nephi we can estimate this journey to take 20 days, especially since Ammon lnew the way.

name: Alma + Amulek Freed from Prison
note:
Alma 14:23 - "12th day, 10th month, 10th year"

-They heal Zeezrom, establish church in Sidom, and return to Zarahemlah

Alma and Amulek in Prison by Gary L. Kapp

name: Lamanites Destroy Ammonihah
note: Alma 16:2 - "5th day of 2nd month of 11th yr"

name: Lam. King and Queen are Converted
Mormon Takes Charge of Nephite Armies
Amalickiah Overthrows Lamanite King
note: Including the deception and murder of Lahonti

name: Teancum Kills Amalickiah
note:
Last DAY of RJ25.
Following day: Lamanites retreat to Mulek.

name: Pahoran I Dies, Pahoran II is Judge
Nephites Retreat to Bountiful
note: They fortify as far north as the narrow neck.

name: Samuel Preaches
note:
RJ86
Image: Book of Mormon Central

name: Both Nephites and Lamanites are Wicked
Jacob's Sermon
note:
3:4 predicts departure from Land of Nephi
3:6 predicts righteousness of Lamanites

name: Lehi Arrives in the Promised Land
Jacob Dies, Gives Plates to Enos
note: Estimated with a birth 5 years after Lehi leaves Jerusalem and an 80 year lifespan.

name: Lehi Blesses His Children and Dies
note: We suppose Lehi died a year or two after the destruction of Jerusalem, which he prophesied had already occurred by 2 Nephi 1.

name: Mosiah I Finds Zarahemla
note: There is no true indication of precisely when this occurred.

name: Alma Believes Abinadi, Teaches, and Baptizes
Alma Leaves Judgement Seat
note:
Commencing RJ9. Alma 4:20
Pahoran is Chief Judge

name: Ammon Defends Lamoni's Flock and Teaches Him
Lamanites Attack and Nephites Flee to Angola
Nephites Flee to Jashon
note: Jashon is near Shim where Ammaron hid the plates.

name: Nephites Destroyed at Cumorah
note: Mormon puts all plates except for BoM in hill Cumorah

name: Helaman sends Letter to Moroni
note: Letter received on 2nd day, 1st month RJ30

name: Unknown Destruction of Nephites
note: There is no record of what happened to the people who stayed behind when Mosiah I left the Land of Nephi. We must assume that they either dissented to the Lamanites or were overtaken by them some time before Zeniff travels back.

name: Gadianton Attempts to Kill Helaman and Escapes
Nephi Prays/Preaches from His Tower
note:
Chief Judge Seezoram murdered by his brother Seantum.
Nephi receives sealing power.

name: Nephi Prays for a Famine to Stop Contentions
Nephites and Lamanites Unite Against Robbers
Robbers Attack Zarahemlah
note:
"In the sixth month" 3 Nephi 4:11.
Giddianhi is slain.

name: Many are Baptized by Nephi's Efforts
All People Are Converted and Baptized
Nephites and Lamanites Split
note: Nephi says this occurs "not many days" after Lehi dies.

name: ‚öîÔ∏è Lamanites Invade, Noah Flees, Limhi is King
Amulon Helps People of Limhi Escape
note: "40 days" until they found Limhi puts this at day 10 of the second month at the earliest.

name: Alma Preaches in Zarahemla and Gideon
Alma Instructs his Sons
note: Although this is recorded in chapters previous to the war, it is clear that it occurs after and as a result of the beginning of the war. See Alma 35:13-16

name: Moroni Raises the Standard of Liberty
Mormon Refuses to Lead Nephites
note: This occurs after the second defense of Desolation.

name: Manti is Liberated
note: By this point Helaman has received no more aid from Zarahemlah

name: All People Gather to Zarahemlah
note: "In the latter end of the 17th year"

name: People Grow Wicked and Kill the Prophets
note: Lachoneus, son of Lachoneus, is Judge

name: Lachoneus II is Killed, Government Collapses
Darkness and Destruction Cover the Land
Nephi Dies and Gives Record to Amos
Mulekites Settle in Zarahemlah
note: They may or may not have called the land Zarahemlah

name: Abinadom Writes
note: Estimated 35 years after his father writes, following the average.

name: Mosiah is King and Record Keeper
People of Alma Arrive in Zarahemla
note: The journey is 13 days from Helam, including a stop in the Valley of Alma

name: Alma the Younger's Conversion
note:
This happened between 100-92 BC. There is no indication of how long it was before the sons of Mosiah started their mission in 92 BC.

At this time, Mosiah is about 60 yrs old. His sons may be around 30

name: Mosiah Proposes Judges
note:
Mosiah dies, age 63, reigned 33yrs.
Alma I dies, age 82

name: Alma is Chief Judge and High Priest
note:
RJ1
Begins after a complete 509 years since Lehi left Jerusalem.

name: Amlici Rebels
note: Commencing RJ5. First battle was at Amnihu

name: Sons of Mosiah Begin Mission
note:
Including Ammon, Aaron, Omner, Himni, Muloki, and others.

Mosiah is worried and prays to the Lord who promises that many will be converted.

name: Anti-Nephi-Lehite Massacre
note:
This occurs shortly before the Lamanites destroy Ammonihah.
Illustration by Dan Burr

name: Lamoni and Aaron build the Church
Alma Gives Records to Helaman and Disappears
Mormon is Born
note: 10 yrs prior to visit from Ammaron

name: Nephites Pact for all Land Northward
Nephites lose Desolation, flee to Teancum
note: Mormon notes that the nephites lost Desolation because they left it to attack the lamanites.

name: Nephites Lose Desolation and Flee
note: Mormon removes all records from Shim

name: Dual-Victory for Nephites
note:
Lamanites defeated at both Ammonihah and Noah.

*Specific date recorded

name: Many Migrate North because of Contention
Nephi and Lehi Preach and are Imprisoned
Lamanites 100% Converted to the Gospel
note:
All Nephite lands are returned.
End RJ62

name: Nephites Repent and Cast Out Robbers
Amos Dies and Gives Record to Amos
People Divide into Nephites and Lamanites
Enos Dies, Gives Plates to Jarom
